intro: Malvastrum purdiaei var. huantense, commonly known as the Huanténsis mallow, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and showy, pale pink to white flowers that bloom in summer. It typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed areas. The leaves are ovate to elliptic, with a rough texture and prominent veins.
